de.boereck.matcher.function.optionalmap

Interface OptionalDoubleMapper<I>

  • Type Parameters:
    I - Type of input to the function
    All Superinterfaces:
    Function<I,OptionalDouble>
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface OptionalDoubleMapper<I>
extends Function<I,OptionalDouble>
    Function mapping an input of type I to an OptionalDouble. The result of this function should never be null, even though most combinator methods of this interface are prepared for this. This interface is especially useful when working with NoResultCaseMatcher.caseDouble(Function, DoubleConsumer), or ResultCaseMatcher.caseDouble(Function, DoubleFunction).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> filter(DoublePredicate after)
      Returns an optional mapper filtering the OptionalDouble returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper with the given predicate after.
      default <V> OptionalMapper<I,V> flatMap(DoubleFunction<Optional<V>> after)
      Returns a function that will call this OptionalDoubleMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalDouble contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional.
      default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> flatMapD(DoubleFunction<OptionalDouble> after)
      Returns a function that will call this OptionalDoubleMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalDouble contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional.
      default OptionalIntMapper<I> flatMapI(DoubleFunction<OptionalInt> after)
      Returns a function that will call this OptionalDoubleMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalDouble contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional.

      Returns a function that will call this OptionalDoubleMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalDouble contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional.
      default Predicate<I> hasResult()
      Returns a function that will call this OptionalDoubleMapper and checks if the returned OptionalDouble contains a value.
      default Predicate<I> hasResultAnd(DoublePredicate test)
      Returns a predicate checking if the optional returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper is not null, holds a value, and if the predicate test returns true for this value.

      Returns a function that will first call this OptionalDoubleMapper and afterwards calls checks if the OptionalDouble contains a value.

      default OptionalLongMapper<I> mapL(DoubleToLongFunction after)
      Returns a function that will first call this OptionalDoubleMapper and afterwards calls checks if the OptionalDouble contains a value.
      default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> nullAware()
      This method will return a function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional.
      default TestableToDoubleFunction<I> orElse(double o)
      Returns a function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalDoubleMapper with it, and calls orElse on the returned Optional with the given value o.
      default TestableToDoubleFunction<I> orElseGet(DoubleSupplier supplier)
      Returns a function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalDoubleMapper with it, and calls orElseGet on the returned OptionalDouble with the given value supplier.
      default TestableToDoubleFunction<I> partial()
      Converts this optional mapper to a function that will perform the mapper and check if there is a result available and return it.

    • Method Detail

      • map

        default <V> OptionalMapper<I,V> map(DoubleFunction<? extends V> after)
                             throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that will first call this OptionalDoubleMapper and afterwards calls checks if the OptionalDouble contains a value. If so, the value in the optional will be used as an input to the given mapping function after and returned in an optional, otherwise an empty optional will be returned. If the result of this OptionalDoubleMapper is null, an empty OptionalDouble will be returned.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of element held by output optional
        Parameters:
        after - mapping function that will be called on the value of the returned OptionalDouble of this OptionalDoubleMapper. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        function mapping the result value of this OptionalDoubleMapper (provided the OptionalDouble holds a value).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameter after is null.

If the result of this OptionalDoubleMapper is null, an empty OptionalInt will be returned.
        Parameters:
        after - mapping function that will be called on the value of the returned OptionalDouble of this OptionalDoubleMapper. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        function mapping the result value of this OptionalDoubleMapper (provided the OptionalDouble holds a value).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameter after is null.

      • flatMap

        default <V> OptionalMapper<I,V> flatMap(DoubleFunction<Optional<V>> after)
                                 throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that will call this OptionalDoubleMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalDouble contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional. If the optional returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper is null or empty, the resulting function will return an empty optional.
        Type Parameters:
        V - result type of optional returned by after mapper function.
        Parameters:
        after - mapping function that will be called with the value of the OptionalDouble returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        function that will call this OptionalDoubleMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalDouble contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional. If the optional returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper is empty or null, the resulting function will return an empty optional.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will the thrown if after is null.

If the optional returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper is empty or null, the resulting function will return an empty optional.

      • filter

        default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> filter(DoublePredicate after)
                                throws NullPointerException
        Returns an optional mapper filtering the OptionalDouble returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper with the given predicate after. This means that function returns an empty OptionalDouble if either this OptionalDoubleMapper returns null, or an empty OptionalDouble, or if the OptionalDouble returned from this OptionalDoubleMapper holds a value, but the predicate after returns false for the value held in the OptionalDouble. If the predicate returns true, the function will return the OptionalDouble returned from this OptionalDoubleMapper.
        Parameters:
        after - function being used to filter on the OptionalLong returned from this OptionalLongMapper. This parameter must not be null.
        Returns:
        optional mapper filtering the OptionalLong returned by this OptionalLongMapper with the given predicate after.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if after is null.

      • hasResult

        default Predicate<I> hasResult()
        Returns a function that will call this OptionalDoubleMapper and checks if the returned OptionalDouble contains a value. If this OptionalDoubleMapper returns null, the predicate will return false.
        Returns:
        function checking if the result of this OptionalDoubleMapper is not null and holds a value

      • hasResultAnd

        default Predicate<I> hasResultAnd(DoublePredicate test)
                           throws NullPointerException
        Returns a predicate checking if the optional returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper is not null, holds a value, and if the predicate test returns true for this value.
        Parameters:
        test - predicate checking if the result value returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper
        Returns:
        predicate checking if optional value returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper is tested positive. is not null, holds a value, and if the predicate test returns true for this value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if test is null.

        default Consumer<I> thenDo(Consumer<OptionalDouble> consumer)
                    throws NullPointerException
        Returns a consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalDoubleMapper with it, and feeds the result to the given consumer.
        Parameters:
        consumer - consumes the result of this OptionalDoubleMapper, when the returned Consumer is invoked.
        Returns:
        consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalDoubleMapper with it, and feeds the result to the parameter consumer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consumer is null.

      • thenIfPresent

        default Consumer<I> thenIfPresent(DoubleConsumer consumer)
                           throws NullPointerException
        Returns a consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalDoubleMapper with it, if the returned Optional holds a value, feeds this value to the given consumer.
        Parameters:
        consumer - consumes the result value of the Optional returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper (if value is present), when the returned Consumer is invoked.
        Returns:
        consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalDoubleMapper with it, and feeds the content of the resulting Optional to the parameter consumer (if value exists).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consumer is null.

      • orElse

        default TestableToDoubleFunction<I> orElse(double o)
        Returns a function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalDoubleMapper with it, and calls orElse on the returned Optional with the given value o. If the Optional returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper is null, the function will return value o.
        Parameters:
        o - value that will be returned from the function returned by this method if either this OptionalDoubleMapper returns null, or an empty OptionalDouble.
        Returns:
        function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalDoubleMapper with it, and calls orElse on the returned OptionalDouble with the given value o. If the OptionalDouble returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper is null, the function will return value o.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consumer is null.

      • orElseGet

        default TestableToDoubleFunction<I> orElseGet(DoubleSupplier supplier)
                                       throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalDoubleMapper with it, and calls orElseGet on the returned OptionalDouble with the given value supplier. If the Optional returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper is null, the function will return the value provided by supplier.
        Parameters:
        supplier - supplies value that will be returned from the function returned by this method if either this OptionalDoubleMapper returns null, or an empty OptionalDouble.
        Returns:
        function taking an input value, calls this OptionalDoubleMapper with it, and calls orElseGet on the returned OptionalDouble with the given value supplier. If the OptionalDouble returned by this OptionalDoubleMapper is null, the function will return the value provided by supplier.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consumer is null.

      • nullAware

        default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> nullAware()
        This method will return a function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional. Otherwise it will call this OptionalDoubleMapper and if the result is not null, returns it. If the result is null, an empty OptionalDouble will be returned. So effectively null checks will be performed on input and output of the function. Exceptions being thrown during the execution of this OptionalDoubleMapper will also be thrown at the caller of the returned function.
        Returns:
        function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional. Otherwise it will call this OptionalDoubleMapper and if the result is not null, returns it. If the result is null, an empty OptionalDouble will be returned.

      • withCatch

        default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> withCatch()
        The returned function will execute this OptionalDoubleMapper and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an Exception, this will be caught and swallowed(!); the function will return an empty OptionalDouble in this case. It is recommended to handle the exception, e.g. by using method <E extends Throwable> withCatch(Class<E>, Consumer<E>) or withCatch(Consumer<Exception>) instead.
        Returns:
        function that will execute this OptionalDoubleMapper and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an Exception, this will be caught and swallowed(!); the function will return an empty OptionalDouble in this case.

      • withCatch

        default <E extends Throwable> OptionalDoubleMapper<I> withCatch(Class<E> clazz,
                                                                Consumer<E> handler)
                                                         throws NullPointerException
        The returned function will execute this OptionalDoubleMapper and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an throwable of type clazz, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the Exception; the function will return an empty OptionalDouble in this case. Throwables of other types will be re-thrown. If the handler itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Type Parameters:
        E - type of throwable to be caught
        Parameters:
        clazz - type of throwable to be caught
        handler - consumer handling the throwable
        Returns:
        function that will execute this OptionalDoubleMapper and potentially handling exceptions of type clazz with handler. After handling exceptions, the function will return an empty OptionalDouble.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if clazz or handler are null.

      • withCatch

        default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> withCatch(Consumer<Exception> handler)
                                   throws NullPointerException
        The returned function will execute this OptionalDoubleMapper and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an exception, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the exception; the function will return an empty OptionalDouble in this case. If the handler itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Parameters:
        handler - will handle exceptions being thrown during the execution of this OptionalDoubleMapper
        Returns:
        function execution this OptionalDoubleMapper and if execution performs without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an exception of type clazz, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the exception; the function will return an empty OptionalDouble in this case.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if handler is null.

      • recoverWith

        default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> recoverWith(Function<? super Throwable,OptionalDouble> recovery)
                                     throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function executing this OptionalDoubleMapper and if a throwable is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. If an empty OptionalDouble should be returned, consider using method withCatch() instead. If the recovery method itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Parameters:
        recovery - method providing a regular result value if the OptionalDoubleMapper throws an exception.
        Returns:
        function executing this OptionalDoubleMapper and if a throwable is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. If an empty OptionalDouble should be returned, consider using method withCatch() instead.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if recovery is null.

      • recoverWith

        default <E extends Throwable> OptionalDoubleMapper<I> recoverWith(Class<E> clazz,
                                                                  Function<? super E,OptionalDouble> recovery)
        Returns a function executing this OptionalDoubleMapper and if a an exception of type E is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. Exceptions of other types will be re-thrown to the caller. If the recovery method itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Type of exceptions to be caught and recovered from.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class of exceptions to be caught and recovered from.
        recovery - function recovering from an exception providing a regular value to return from the returned function.
        Returns:
        function executing this OptionalDoubleMapper and if a an exception of type E is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. Exceptions of other types will be re-thrown to the caller.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if clazz or recovery are null.

      • partial

        default TestableToDoubleFunction<I> partial()
        Converts this optional mapper to a function that will perform the mapper and check if there is a result available and return it. If the returned optional is null or empty, the function will throw a NoSuchElementException.
        Returns:
        function not defined on inputs produce empty optionals. This means that if there this mapper produces an optional holding a value, this will be returned. Otherwise a NoSuchElementException is thrown.
